# Arpeggio: Major 7th in B (Shape: A)

## Brief Presentation
This arpeggio is a Major 7th chord in the key of B. It follows the shape known as Shape A on the guitar. A Major 7th arpeggio consists of the 1st, 3rd, 5th, and 7th notes of the major scale in a particular key.

## Notes and Intervals
- Root (B)
- Major 3rd (D#)
- Perfect 5th (F#)
- Major 7th (A#)
  
## Musical Flavor and Usage
This Major 7th arpeggio in B has a smooth and jazzy quality. It is often used in jazz, bossa nova, and other styles where a sophisticated and colorful sound is desired. The Major 7th chord is known for its lush and dreamy character, adding a sense of nostalgia and sophistication to compositions.
